boat.full_description:
Felix was launched in 1982, the inspiration of two men: Andrew Wolstenholme, a young designer who had spent time on the north east coast of the USA and David Moss, a Lancashire boat builder. The design is influenced by the catboat's of Cape Cod.

In an article in 'The Boatman', April 1996, Martin Tregoning discussed the catboat's design and rig, taking Felix as an example. He compares catboats and gaffers for speed and stability, summing up the article as follows:

The basic catboat has a well for an outboard but 'Felix' has a small inboard to give that extra security when sailing offshore. Last year [1995] her owners sailed her to the Isles of Scilly which shows a measure of their confidence in her sea-keeping abilities. All in all this boat was great fun to sail and even more, I would imagine, to own. She sailed and handled well, an ideal daysailer or even weekender for those who enjoy camping. The new sailing horizons that she could open up in any estuary or river complex would provide a new dimension to someone who has owned larger and deeper craft but is now seeking all the fun but with less work during the winter months She is also the kind of boat that might tempt an owner to keep her in the water all year round, just to enjoy those sunny days of solitude during the off season.
boat.name: Felix
boat.short_description: 'Felix' is a cat boat, designed by Andrew Wolstenholme and built by David Moss Boatbuilders in 1982.
